meanings.def: to go against or refuse to obey a law, an agreement, etc.
examples: They have flagrantly violated the treaty.
The directive violates fundamental human rights.

meanings.def: to upset or not respect somebody’s peace, privacy, etc.
examples: She accused the press photographers of violating her privacy.
The peace of the island community had been brutally violated.
The peace of this island community has been repeatedly violated.
Their voices sounded shrill and incongruous, violating the silence.

meanings.def: to damage or destroy a holy or special place
to force somebody to have sex
examples: He had drugged her and then violated her.
